alert.note: Alert for Cheshire; Hillsborough; Merrimack (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 08 at 6:37PM EDT until September 08 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray Maine has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Cheshire County in southern New Hampshire... Hillsborough County in southern New Hampshire... Southwestern Merrimack County in central New Hampshire... * Until 715 PM EDT. * At 637 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Antrim to near Peterborough to near Rindge, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Jaffrey, Henniker, Bedford, Milford, Amherst, Peterborough, Hopkinton, New Boston, Antrim, Mont Vernon, Greenfield, Lyndeborough, Bradford, Dublin, Francestown, Bennington, Harrisville, Nelson, Rindge, and Windsor. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 7 and 19. This also includes... North Pack Monadnock. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
